metadata.title: FA Analyze 13 05

config.question: According to historian Frederick Merk, why were most Americans opposed to adding all of Mexico to the United States?

choices.content: They believed only white people should be added to the United States for reasons of race.
They felt that adding all of Mexico would make it too difficult to govern the United States.
They believed that the United States had already reached its natural boundaries.
They were opposed to the spread of slavery.

answer_3.response: Consider This: Mexicans, according to Merk, would have to be ruled the way the British governed India, and the possession of colonial dependencies was contrary to American ideals and traditions. Merk’s thesis sheds light on why the general public had little appetite for swallowing all of Mexico, but those actually making policy had more mundane and practical reasons for being satisfied with what Guadalupe Hidalgo obtained. See L.O. 13.1 Why did the United States annex Texas and the Southwest?
